thread.title: 'Stranger Things 2' trailer, dissected shot by spooky shot - CNET
thread.title_full: 'Stranger Things 2' trailer, dissected shot by spooky shot - CNET

title: 'Stranger Things 2' trailer, dissected shot by spooky shot - CNET
text:
'Stranger Things 2' trailer, dissected shot by spooky shot Eleven upside-down 
Warning: If you don't want "Stranger Things" spoilers, don't watch the new trailer or scroll through this gallery. 
During the Super Bowl Sunday, Netflix released the first trailer for "Stranger Things 2," which debuts on Halloween. 
The trailer begins with a vintage commercial for Eggo waffles, a favorite snack of Eleven (Millie Bobby Brown). Then it shows her, bloody nose and all. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer Ghostbusters ride! 
Dustin (Gaten Matarazzo), Mike (Finn Wolfhard) and Lucas (Caleb McLaughlin) ride like the wind on their bikes while dressed as "Ghostbusters" characters for Halloween. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer Hopper still in uniform 
Police chief Jim Hopper (David Harbour) tries and fails to keep something at bay. He still has his badge, but is he also working for another elusive government agency? Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer Who ya gonna call? 
Dustin, Mike and Lucas wear "Ghostbusters" costumes for Halloween, so fingers crossed the new season also includes upset spirits. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer Stabbing evil? 
Hopper looks rather Indiana Jones-esque in this mysterious scene of him hopefully stabbing a monster with a stake. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer Dept. of Energy returns? 
Hazmat suits could only mean one thing -- either the Dept. of Energy or another covert government agency is testing something strange again. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer How's Will feeling? 
When we left Will (Noah Schnapp) at the end of the first season of "Stranger Things," he coughed up a creepy critter. Here he's being checked by a doctor as mom Joyce Byers (Winona Ryder) looking on. But is this doctor legit or working for the bad guys? Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer All eyes are on Will 
Will is just one of the subjects on these TV screens. That begs the question: how many other experiments are there and who is behind them? Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer A killer headache 
This looks a lot like Eleven having a breakdown, but perhaps on closer inspection it could be Will? Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer Drawing of doom 
This sketch of the new monster that will invade "Stranger Things 2" looks a lot larger than the Demogorgon that terrified the characters last season. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer Knock, knock... 
This homage shot reminiscent of the '70s sci-fi classic "Close Encounters of the Third Kind" has Will, or maybe Mike, about to open the door to see the ultimate monster. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET Stormy new evil looms in 'Stranger Things 2' trailer A stormy evil approaches... 
A better look at the gigantic monster that will be introduced in "Stranger Things 2" -- as well as in our nightmares. Photo by: Video screenshot by Bonnie Burton/CNET
